subject: Technology
title: Lithium-Ion Batteries Explained
description: A short lesson to help you apply Lithium-Ion Batteries Explained.

hook.text: Your phone does a thousand things. Its biggest limitation is the battery that powers all of them.

buildup.text: Lithium-ion batteries store energy by moving lithium ions between two electrodes through a liquid.

discovery.text: They pack more energy into less space than any previous battery type. That's why phones got so thin.

twist.text: Lithium-ion batteries degrade with every charge. After two years, they hold noticeably less energy.

climax.text: Battery technology improves about 5% per year. Screens and processors improve much faster, widening the gap.

punchline.text: Everything in your phone got better except the battery.

quiz.question: Why do phone batteries degrade over time?
options: Lithium-ion batteries lose capacity with every charge cycle
The phone uses more power as it ages
